The Death Eaters flew around the bridge in a spiral motion to create a twisting and buckling movement on the bridge walkway, and proceeded to fire blasts onto the bridge (at least seven, according to witness reports). The cables snapping, the bridge undulated and twisted intensely, pulling free of its piers, ultimately splitting in half and crashing violently into the Thames below, killing some Muggles who were crossing the bridge at the time. Immediately after the disaster, a police rescue team started pulling survivors from the river, even while the bridge continued to crumble around them. Westminster's Anti-Terrorism Unit and the Metropolitan Police could retrieve "nothing of value" to help figure out the responsible or how whatever devices used had been planted on the bridge without anyone seeing them before, during, and after the attack. CCTV footage retrieved by Anna Hill-Hall of the Metropolitan Police did not provide any clues, not did amateur footage, such as Anji Oliver's recording of the incident in her mobile phone camera — the blasts could be seen, but no source could be identified, even though they seemed to have been fired onto the bridge. Penelope Taylor suffered a broken leg and pelvis in the collapse, although she recognised that she could have been one of the casualties if she did not stop to try and see the "plumes of smoke" she had glimpsed in the sky. While some Muggles, like Taylor, thought that the attack could not have been the work of any human foe ("I know that these were devils, punishing us for our decadent Western lifestyle"), others, like Lucy Evans, were more earth-bound and blamed foreigners.

27 october.summary: 27 October is the 300th day of the year (301st in leap years).

richard harris.summary: He played Albus Dumbledore in the first two Harry Potter films, that is, Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone and Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets. He at first declined the offer to play Dumbledore; however, upon hearing the news that her grandfather had a very good shot at playing the role, his granddaughter told him that if he did not go back and take the part, she would never speak to him again. In his career, he was nominated for two Best Actor Academy Awards: for This Sporting Life in 1964, and The Field in 1991. He was also an accomplished musician and singer: he released several albums, and his single "MacArthur Park" reached #2 on the American Billboard Hot 100 chart. In 1957, he married Elizabeth Rees-Williams, daughter of David Rees-Williams; they divorced in 1969, and Elizabeth married another actor, Rex Harrison. Their three children are actor Jared Harris, actor Jamie Harris (born Tudor St John Harris, but known as Jamie since childhood), and director Damian Harris (who has a son named Marlowe, born 2002, with Australian actress Peta Wilson). Richard Harris married secondly the American actress Ann Turkel, who was 16 years his junior, but that marriage also ended in divorce. Harris died of Hodgkin's Disease in 2002 at the age of 72, about two weeks before the U.S. première of Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets.

20 june.summary: 20 June is the 171st day of the year (172nd in leap years).

14 june.summary: 14 June is the 165th day of the year (166th in leap years).

samson wiblin.summary: He was the favourite to win the All-England Wizarding Duelling Competition of 1430, but was beaten by Alberta Toothill, who hit him with a Blasting Curse.

brockdale bridge.summary: It was built around 1985 and destroyed by Death Eaters sometime between 28 June and 5 July, 1996. About ten years old at the time of its destruction in 1996, the bridge collapsed and killed a dozen driving Muggles. In the summer of 1996, Lord Voldemort ordered Cornelius Fudge to step aside from his position as Minister for Magic, with the threat of a mass Muggle killing if he did not do so. Fudge refused to step down, and thus Voldemort ordered Death Eaters to attack the Brockdale Bridge. In the Muggle society, the best experts were at a loss on how the perfectly constructed bridge would just cleanly snap in two. Only the Muggle Prime Minister, who was briefed by Fudge, knew the truth of what happened.

robert hardy.summary: His long career in the theatre, film and television spanned more than 70 years with memorable screen roles such as Siegfried in All Creatures Great and Small (1978–1980 and 1988–1990), and Sir Winston Churchill, most notably in Winston Churchill: The Wilderness Years (1981), for which he won a BAFTA award. He wrote and presented an acclaimed television documentary on the subject of the Battle of Agincourt and wrote two books on the subject of the longbow, Longbow: A Social and Military History and The Great Warbow; From Hastings to the Mary Rose with Matthew Strickland.

cornelius fudges wife.summary: Barty Crouch Snr once suffered an attack of delirium in which he mentioned that his wife and son were to attend a concert with the couple.

elizabeth ii.summary: In September 1991, one of the Queen's corgwn was transformed into a hamster by an unknown witch or wizard, prompting the Improper Use of Magic Office to launch an investigation and question several suspects. Muggle authorities, on the other hand, concluded that the Queen's corgi had been stolen and replaced with a hamster as a "cruel" prank. The name "Elizabeth" comes from Ελισαβετ (Elisabet), the Greek form of the Hebrew name אֱלִישֶׁבַע (Elisheva) meaning "my God is an oath" or perhaps "my God is abundance".

unbreakable vow.summary: An Unbreakable Vow (incantation unknown) was a type of binding magical contract cast between two parties, that if broken by either party, would result in the imminent death of whoever broke the contract. Then, the first will ask a certain number of vows of the other, whereupon each time the second accepts a term, a thin stream of fire will be emitted from the witness's wand, weaving around the hands of the pair taking the vows. Sometime prior to 1901, Yusuf Kama made an Unbreakable Vow with his father where he promised to track down and kill the son of Corvus Lestrange in retaliation for taking Yusuf's mother away from them. This vow, however, turned out to be null and void, as the child he thought was his intended victim turned out to be someone else entirely, and the person whom he had sworn to kill was already long dead. In either 1985 or 1986, Fred and George Weasley attempted to convince their then five-year-old brother Ron to make an Unbreakable Vow with them. It was described as the only time he was as angry as his wife, and it is said that he did something to Fred's left buttock leaving it never the same again; luckily however, their brother Ron was left unhurt, although he remembered the incident at least eleven years later. At some point between 1984 and 1990, Jacob's sibling offered to make an Unbreakable Vow with Chiara Lobosca to ensure they would never betray her.

henry vii.summary: Henry VII (28 January 1457 – 21 April 1509) was King of England from his seizure of the crown in 1485 until his death. The name "Henry" comes from the Germanic name Heimirich which meant "home ruler", composed of the elements heim "home" and ric "power, ruler". It was later commonly spelled Heinrich, with the spelling altered due to the influence of other Germanic names like Haganrich, in which the first element is hagan "enclosure".

corgi to hamster spell.summary: The Improper Use of Magic Office investigated the incident, questioning multiple suspects, while Muggle authorities concluded the dog had been stolen and replaced with a hamster as a "cruel" prank, and launched a "full scale" search for it.

alliance.summary: Fanatics dedicated to Grindelwald's ideology of Wizarding supremacy, they referred to themselves as his "acolytes". Their main goal was to expose the world wizarding community and provoke a war with Non-magic people, with the intent overturning the International Statute of Wizarding Secrecy and eventually forcing the non-magical population into slavery under their motto: "For the Greater Good". While many of the acolytes were fervent believers in Grindelwald’s mantra of magical supremacy at any cost, most were simply idealistic young witches and wizards who were taken in by the dark wizard's charisma and manipulation. Between about 1900, when Grindelwald fled Britain, and 1945, the year of his downfall, Dark Wizard Gellert Grindelwald formed an army of witches and wizards. Grindelwald intended to unite the Deathly Hallows, which he believed would make him and his followers invincible. There, he gave a rousing speech, in which he shared his idealist perspective of non-magic people and told of the Second World War, implying it would come to pass if the army lost to the wizarding governments. Grindelwald, openly recognising the battalion of Aurors that had infiltrated the rally, told his followers to remain calm as he revealed their presence and invited them into the circle. They killed a young witch, making Grindelwald's followers furious. After making a martyr of the girl, Grindelwald commanded his followers to disapparate from the scene while he faced off against the Aurors.

charlus potter.summary: Charlus was the uncle by marriage of Alphard, Cygnus and Walburga Black, thus he is the great-uncle of Sirius Black III and Regulus Black II, as well as Bellatrix Lestrange, Andromeda Tonks and Narcissa Malfoy. As well as this, Charlus is the great-great uncle of Draco Malfoy and Nymphadora Tonks and the great-great-great uncle of Scorpius Malfoy and Ted Lupin.

abraham potter.summary: Abraham was born into the American branch of the Potter family, which traces its origins to Ignotus Peverell, one of the three brothers mentioned in The Tale of the Three Brothers in The Tales of Beedle the Bard; and Linfred of Stinchcombe, nicknamed The Potterer, a pioneering potioneer credited with the invention of numerous medicinal potions. This makes him a distant relative of the famous Harry Potter, a fact which would be uncovered by eager genealogists centuries later. He was, along with eleven other wizards and witches, one of the first Aurors in the United States of America, being recruited by Josiah Jackson, the first President of MACUSA.

angelina johnsons father.summary: In July 2014, shortly before the final of the 2014 Quidditch World Cup, he fell ill, and Angelina left her marital home to care for him.

9 july.summary: 9 July is the 190th day of the year (191st in leap years).

nigeria versus fiji.summary: The article covered the match between the Nigerian and Fijian National Quidditch teams, part of the 2014 Quidditch World Cup. The article covered Fiji's loss by a large margin to Nigeria, partially due to Fiji's Seeker Joseph Snuka catching the Golden Snitch despite being his team being more than 150 points behind. Pity Fijian Seeker Joseph Snuka as he tries to justify his side's bruising 400 - 160 defeat at the hands of tournament favourites Nigeria. The Bludgers did serious damage to the Fijian Chasers, who managed only a single goal during the first hour, compared with Nigeria's forty. To the bewilderment of commentators, the fury of Fijian supporters and the jeers of the Nigerians, Seeker Snuka chose to capture the Snitch in the 141st minute, when his team was trailing 400-10. While there is precedent for a Seeker choosing to catch the Snitch if so doing will minimise the margin by which their team are about to lose (the most famous recent occasion being Viktor Krum's Snitch capture in the 1994 final), Snuka's counterpart Samuel Equiano was some distance away when he chose to snatch the Snitch from the air.

14 march.summary: 14 March is the 73rd day (74th in leap years) of the year.

astoria malfoys ancestor.summary: The curse resurfaced after several generations in Astoria, and was responsible for her lifelong frailty and untimely death.

panju weasley.summary: In this universe, Ron married Padma instead of Hermione Granger, since Hermione never dated Viktor Krum, which in the main timeline made him jealous and prompted him to act on his feelings. According to his father, he usually laughed when confronted about his behaviour, and had a cocky smile that everyone wanted to wipe off his face. When Panju landed in trouble at Hogwarts during the 2020-2021 school year, his father went to the school to talk to him in person instead of sending a Howler, since his mother thought this would be more effective. In another incident later that same school year, Panju ended up with no eyebrows and a "rather large" moustache after a mishap in Potions class, prompting his father to once again pay a visit to Hogwarts to talk to him. Ron's comments about Panju helped Albus and Scorpius realise that their actions had changed history and created an alternate reality.

mordecai berrycloth.summary: In the 2010s, Mordecai Berrycloth visited the Department for the Regulation and Control of Magical Creatures, where he held a course in combative magic for their field members; Magizoologist members of the Statute of Secrecy Task Force were also in attendance.

ministry detention area.summary: It was a dark-tiled area, with circular corridors and gilded gates closing the holding cells in which suspects were confined before their trial and, if convicted, pending transportation to Azkaban.

lead auror.summary: A lead Auror was a designation held by some members of the Auror Office at the Ministry of Magic in London to denote a member of the Investigation Department put in charge of an investigation. Penelope Fawley were named lead Auror at some point during her career, in which capacity she began working alongside then Head research assistant and her eventual husband Grim, whereupon the two of them fell in love solving crimes together. Harry Potter, the Head of the Auror Office, served provisionally as lead Auror when he took charge of the London Five investigation.

ministry of magic witch watchers.summary: The Ministry of Magic Witch Watchers were a special Ministry of Magic force that was presumably stationed at strategic places in search of fugitive criminals. Taken by surprise and in a desperate measure to seize Black, Minister Cornelius Fudge ordered hundreds of Witch Watchers to the village. The Ministry's attempt to catch Black was unsuccessful, however, as he had already left Dufftown when the Witch Watchers arrived.

investigative assistant.summary: Investigative Assistant was a position held by some members of the Auror Office at the Ministry of Magic in London, and denoted a member of the Investigation Department that assisted a lead Auror with their investigations.

daphne de beistegui.summary:
She was cast as Harry Potter and Ginny Weasley's youngest child and only daughter somewhere either in 2009 or early 2010 given that the production of the Deathly Hallows films—both parts one and two—were shot back-to-back as one film from 19 February 2009 to 12 June 2010. The reshoot took place at Leavesden Studios on a sound stage opposed to reusing the real station, which made filming difficult during the previous attempt. According to her on-screen brother Will Dunn (James Potter II), Daphne followed Daniel Radcliffe through the set always hugging him, even when they were not filming. Daniel Radcliffe later mentioned in an interview for Total Film Indonesia:
De Beistegui was born in Westminster, London to an upper middle-class family, the youngest daughter of Meica de Beistegui (née O'Mara) and Miguel (b. 3 April 1966), a University Lecturer of the Centre for Research in Modern European Philosophy at the University of Warwick in Coventry and a published author. She previously lived in Birmingham though as of 2013, resided in the Royal Crescent, Holland Park, West London with her parents and older sister, Sophie (b. ca.

ellie darceyalden.summary:
It was not yet decided by the producers that the final book in the series would be split into two parts and once this decision was made, Darcey-Alden was expected to "re-audition over a year later" in December 2009 and "luckily still met the height and role requirements." She recalled:
On 25 January 2010, she was called back for a second audition at Pinewood Studios where she met director David Yates and worked with a number of other potentials for the parts of young James Potter, Sirius Black, Severus Snape and Lily Evans. She subsequently received a screen-test with then 13-year-old Benedict Clarke (who would be cast as young Severus Snape) "as well as an associated costume, hair and makeup meeting" at Leavesden Studios, where she met then 21-year-old actor Daniel Radcliffe on her first day. A few weeks later in February, her mother was contacted by the producers and after school, Darcey-Alden was told that she received the part of young Lily Evans, cast at age 10, in the commercially successful Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2. She said:
In the film, Darcey-Alden appears in a flashback sequence as Harry's mother in her schooldays and reveals how she befriended Snape as a child, which is crucial in explaining the back story of the shady professor and his complex relationship to Harry's deceased parents, particularly his bitter resentment to his father, James. When production began, she was not allowed to tell her close friends of her casting in Potter as she left school for Leavesden Studios and Hatfield House to film her scenes. She said:
Filming her scenes along with Benedict Clarke (young Snape), Ariella Paradise (young Petunia), Alfie McIlwain (young James) and Rohan Gotobed (young Sirius) took place in April 2010. According to Darcey-Alden and Clarke at a 2013 LeakyCon cast junket in London, production alternated between sets at Leavesden Studios and on location shooting by the River Lea in the gardens of Hatfield Park near Hatfield House in Hertfordshire.

will dunn.summary: A newcomer to the film industry, this is Will's first professional role. Since then he has played Jack in My Song, a short film, which premièred on Film4 and the Community Channel on May 23. In early May he finished filming Zeus, a student film, in which he played the lead role, James. Will describes himself as a keen actor, who loves playing guitar (since the age of nine, as he remarked when answering a fan question), hanging out with mates, and just generally chilling out. Will has also posted a video of himself playing guitar on his official YouTube channel, and has said that he would like to do more videos.

viktor krums father.summary: Mr Krum travelled to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry with his wife to watch Viktor face the final task of the Triwizard Tournament in 1995.

viktor krums mother.summary: Mrs Krum travelled to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry with her husband to watch Viktor face the final task of the Triwizard Tournament in 1995.

krum family.summary: Krum of Bulgaria was a ninth-century ruler of Bulgaria who greatly expanded his country's territory and who instituted the first known written Bulgarian law code giving state protection to the poor.

bulgarian.summary: Магичен Теория (English: Magical Theory) was a Bulgarian-language textbook used by students of the Durmstrang Institute. Durmstrang students could be seen carrying around copies of this book while staying at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry for the Triwizard Tournament during the 1994–1995 school year.

nurmengard castle.summary: Originally built by Gellert Grindelwald to hold his opponents, it also served as the base of operations for Grindelwald and his followers. Ultimately, it was used to imprison Grindelwald himself after his defeat by Albus Dumbledore in 1945, until his death in 1998. By 1926, the castle also served as the headquarters for Grindelwald and his Alliance during the Global wizarding war. After a number of years of terrorising Europe, Grindelwald was confronted and defeated in a duel between him and his former best friend and lover Albus Dumbledore in 1945. It is unknown if there were any other prisoners ever held at Nurmengard, but around the time of Grindelwald's death, it is likely that he was the only prisoner present as the past inmates were likely incarcerated there at Grindelwald's behest. Grindelwald was certainly fed and kept alive for fifty-three years, so there was at least a supply of food and someone (or something) bringing it to him, although he was emaciated, frail and missing teeth. In his quest for the Elder Wand, Lord Voldemort travelled to Nurmengard in 1998, using his skills of Flight and possibly Human Transfiguration to break into Grindelwald's cell. After confronting him for information on the Wand's location, Voldemort killed Grindelwald and then flew away.

noriko sato.summary: During the seventh round match of the 427th Quidditch World Cup, against Poland, Sato narrowly beat Polish Seeker, Wladyslaw Wolfke to the Snitch in the 59th minute. The turning point of the game was the staggeringly powerful shot hit by Hongo, one of the Japanese Beaters, that smashed the tail off Nigerian Seeker Samuel Equiano's broomstick. As Equiano span out of control, Sato soared through the middle of the action to seize the Snitch from the midst of distracted Nigerian players intent on saving their teammate in the 63rd minute. Boris Vulchanov, a Bulgarian Beater, deliberately intercepted a Bludger with his body to protect Viktor Krum, the Bulgerian Seeker. Krum, instead of taking advantage of Sato's temporary incapacitation, Krum pulled up and let the Snitch go by. The Snitch appeared for the second time and Sato raced against Krum, but lost. Later, Sato was led to believe that Krum was escaping Hongo's line of sight when he had really spotted the Snitch and dived for it, leading Bulgaria to victory.

inigo fuente marrero.summary: Together with teammate Tiago Montoya, the name may be a reference to Íñigo Montoya from the romantic comedy fantasy novel (and the film adaptation) The Princess Bride. "Fuente" means "Fountain" in Spanish, and "Marrero" is an occupational name for a stone breaker ("marrero"), a derivative of "marra", which means "hammer".

asgeir knutsen.summary: During the 1996–1997 school year, Knutsens Chocolate Frog Card could be won by beating Alison Denshaw at an Exploding Snap challenge. The name "Asgeir" is from the Old Norse name Ásgeirr (or possibly the modern Icelandic name Ásgeir), derived from the elements áss meaning "god" and geirr meaning "spear".

polish national quidditch team.summary: In the 2014 Quidditch World Cup, the Polish team was defeated 140-350 by the Japanese National Quidditch Team on May 21st. The team bowed out of the World Cup despite spirited and dynamic play, however the team's youth and inexperience was evident.

1998 quidditch world cup.summary: In Britain, 1997-1998 coincided with the Fall of the Ministry of Magic and the Death Eater regime. In 1997, the Quidditch World Cup was reportedly cancelled (although it is unclear whether the Cup itself was to be cancelled, or simply the participation of British teams). Regardless of the situation, the Death Eaters were defeated in the Battle of Hogwarts in May, 1998, and the Cup was held that summer. In response to the riots that took place on the night of the 1994 final, security at this World Cup was tighter than ever before: one notable incident was the arrest of the Senegalese team mascots, Yumboes, outside the stadium.

rawya zaghloul.summary: She played in the 2002 Quidditch World Cup where she famously beat Bulgarian Seeker Viktor Krum to the Snitch, leading to the Bulgarian National Quidditch team's defeat.

senegalese national quidditch team.summary: The team made it into the 1998 Quidditch World Cup final, but lost against the Malawi. During the 1998 Quidditch World Cup, more stringent security measures were put in place (as a response to the riots that broke out on the night of the final of the previous World Cup). One notable incident was the arrest of the Senegalese team mascots, Yumboes, outside the stadium.

ugandan national quidditch team.summary: The Ugandan team competed in the 1994 Quidditch World Cup, and won their match with Wales, though they did not make it to the final.

new zealand national quidditch team.summary: Their Chaser Dennis Moon was sent off in controversial circumstances, after colliding with Bulgarian Chaser Bogomil Levski in the 106th minute, in an incident which looked accidental to many spectators, but the referee Georgios Xenakis ruled had been caused by Moon.

chinese national quidditch team.summary: The match lasted three days, and it was widely held to have produced some of the finest Quidditch seen this century. Liechtenstein caused a great upset by winning their group over China in the qualifying stages of the 2014 Quidditch World Cup.

scottish national quidditch team.summary: The Scottish team were said to have been "slaughtered" by Luxembourg during their Quidditch World Cup match in 1994. During the Calamity, Scottish National Team played against Ireland in the international Quidditch friendly. Captain John Talisker learned that entire the Irish team members is left-handed, which inspiref a tactical change for Scotland.

german national quidditch team.summary: The team special move, called The Barrenheim Barrage, was played out like football. Todt kicked the Quaffle hard to Blijk, who wove in and out of the opponents, and then she threw to Todt, who abruptly stopped, causing the opposing team to fly past him. The opposing chasers then turned back to see Todt throwing the Quaffle to Brand, who leapt into the air and smacked the Quaffle in. Blijk, who was on the other side of the goals, dropkicked it back towards Todt who gracefully leapt from his broom and brutally headbutted it in. Their flag was black, red and gold.

english national quidditch team.summary: Players on the English Quidditch team wore red and white dresses and ocher protectors on their shoulders, legs and forearms. The team's emblem featured three yellow dragons, two over a background of four chequered squares of red and white. The middle dragon faced right cluthong a Quaffle, while the bottom dragon faced left clutching a Bludger. The English Quidditch Stadium was an oval grass pitch, with white boundary markings and a sanded area below the two sets of hoops at each end. The stands were made of brick and small flags were set across the stands, bearing the colours red, white, and on some flags, yellow. In the World Cup, dubbed the Tournament that Nobody Remembers, English Beater Lucas Bargeworthy was missing half his teeth. The English team participated in the four hundred and twenty-second Quidditch World Cup. The English team's special move was called the Rowntree Counter, and played out as follows: Chasers Edric Vosper, Avery Hawksworth, and Keaton Flitney did a dive and out of the back of their brooms flowed red, white, and blue, signifying the flag of the United Kingdom, and referencing the Red Arrows, a famous English flying squad.

xx creatures.summary: This category is for creatures in the wizarding world that were classified as XX by the British Ministry of Magic.

river troll.summary: The champion from Mahoutokoro School of Magic managed to run across the troll's bridge while it was asleep, disturbing it and causing it to guard the bridge more carefully. Therefore, in order to pass the troll, the Hogwarts potions champion caught some fish (using worms as bait), coated the fish in Shrinking Solution, and then coerced the troll into eating them.

mahoutokoro potions champion.summary: The wizard became a skilled potioneer and at age seventeen or above competed in the Wizarding Schools Potions Championship for the golden cauldron, where he represented his school, Mahoutokoro. At the start of the championship in the enchanted garden, he headed towards the bridge, hoping to get an early lead. Fortunately, the Troll was incapacitated by the Hogwarts potions champion, who used a Shrinking Solution on it.

kopparberg.summary: Between the two locations is a Swedish dragon reservation, which the race passes through, adding to the difficulty and danger.

heathcote barbary.summary: 1974) was a wizard and the rhythm guitarist for the popular wizarding band the Weird Sisters. On 25 December 1994, he performed at the Yule Ball along with the rest of his band at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

justus pilliwickle.summary: Pilliwickle was born in 1862, somewhere in Great Britain, into a family of unknown Blood status. He presumably attended Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry in his youth, being a British wizard. In his adult life, he was a celebrated Head of the Department of Magical Law Enforcement.

james runcie.summary: James Runcie (born 1959)  is the son of Robert Runcie, the former Archbishop of Canterbury, and Rosalind Runcie. James Runcie has produced programmes for the BBC, working in the Arts and Music department. He has produced documentaries such as J.K. Rowling: A Year in the Life for ITV, My Father (on his father Robert Runcie), and a six-part series How Buildings Learn. They have one daughter together, Charlotte, born in 1989, and James is also stepfather to Marilyn's daughter, Rosie Kellagher, born in 1978.

ross family.summary: The first is as a habitational name taken from Rots, a town in Normandy, France, which was likely named based on the Germanic element rod, meaning "clearing." The second is as a habitational name based on places called Ross or Roose, from the Welsh rhós, "upland" or "moors." The third is from the Germanic personal name Rozzo, a pet form of names beginning with the element hrod, "renown."

malcolm mcgonagall.summary: His mother, and his older sister Minerva, worked together to teach him and his younger brother, Robert Jr, that they could not go about showing off their magic. His offspring would often visit his sister's home in Hogsmeade during her brief marriage between 1981 and 1984.

mcgonagall family.summary: The father of Minerva McGonagall, Reverend Robert McGonagall was a Muggle Presbyterian minister who lived in the highlands of Scotland during the early 20th century. He married Isobel Ross, a Hogwarts-educated witch and had several children: Minerva, their oldest child and only daughter, and two younger sons, Malcolm and Robert Jnr. Minerva McGonagall attended Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry and was Sorted into Gryffindor House. She graduated and eventually proceeded to replace Albus Dumbledore as the Transfiguration Professor, as well as Head of Gryffindor House. McGonagall was Sorted into Gryffindor House, the House which was Headed at the time by Minerva McGonagall herself.

isobel rosss father.summary: When Isobel became romantically involved with a Muggle neighbour, Robert McGonagall, she knew her parents would not approve, and thus she chose not to tell them of the relationship.

pride of portree.summary: Fans of the Pride of Portree commonly referred to the team as the "Prides", and their playing robes were purple with a gold star emblazoned on the chest. Known players for Pride of Portree were Chaser Catriona McCormack, Keeper Meaghan McCormack and Seeker Dougal McBride. Catriona McCormack was Chaser and captain of the team, leading them to two League Cups. Nobody could see the Quidditch pitch or the opposing team, because of the Ministry of Magic's invisibility spell on the stadium. The two Seekers collided in their race for the Golden Snitch, and both had illegal jinxes used on them. Arrows Seeker Gregory Cotton came out of a scuffle with Portree Seeker Dougal McBride with the Snitch in his hand, only to have his head transfigured into a cabbage by McBride. McBride defended his actions to the referee, Josiah Plunkett, by claiming that Cotton had hit him with a Jelly-Fingers Curse during the race for the Snitch, and thus deserved to be "cabbaged." Ravenclaw student Cho Chang mentioned the team name when she inquired about former Gryffindor Quidditch Captain Oliver Wood's present Quidditch team to Harry Potter on their date on 14 February, 1996.

hebrides.summary: The Pride of Portree, a Quidditch team, was founded on the Isle of Skye in the Inner Hebrides in 1292, presumably in the town of Portree. In 1718, the Ministry of Magic made plans to create a purpose-built wizarding prison on some Hebrides island.

granian.summary: The Norse hero Sigurd (Siegfried in the Germanic version) had a horse named Grani ('grey') that ran more swiftly than the wind.

probation.summary: Probation was a disciplinary status that teachers at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry could be placed under, in which the staff in question would be monitored more closely to evaluate their future performances, with possible dismissal if their teaching standards did not improve. During his time as Headmaster, Armando Dippet placed Care of Magical Creatures Professor Silvanus Kettleburn on sixty-two periods of probation, though he never found cause to dismiss him. As part of her role as Hogwarts High Inquisitor, Dolores Umbridge was granted the power to inspect teachers, with the supposed purpose of eventually removing those not found to be up to the educational standards set by the Ministry of Magic. She first placed Sybill Trelawney on probation and began inspecting all future lessons of hers, in which Umbridge heavily harassed Trelawney with difficult questions and peer pressure, causing the latter to falter more and more, eventually dismissing her from her teaching post. Rubeus Hagrid was also placed under probation, and like Trelawney, he was faltering from Umbridge's presence, though he escaped from Hogwarts and went into hiding, rather than allowing himself to be formally dismissed. Severus Snape, too, was briefly placed on probation after he stated to Umbridge that it would take a month for him to procure Veritaserum in order for her pursue her goal of interrogating Harry Potter; Snape took this with little concern, and simply left the room apathetically. This period of probation lasted less than a day, however, as Umbridge was soon removed from her post as Hogwarts High Inquisitor and Headmistress once Dumbledore returned to the school. Contradicting to the purpose of a probation, which is to give incentive to the teacher to improve themselves, Umbridge abused her position to further weaken Trelawney and Hagrid's performances under her supervision, as Harry correctly suspected that she was trying to achieve a sacking soon.

ousting of rubeus hagrid.summary: In June 1995, Harry Potter came back from the final task of the Triwizard Tournament carrying the body of fellow champion Cedric Diggory, claiming to have witnessed Cedric's murder at the hands of Lord Voldemort, the notorious Dark Wizard who he had vanquished as a baby fourteen years prior and who was thought to be dead by the wizarding world at large. Incumbent Minister for Magic, Cornelius Fudge, refused to believe either Harry or Albus Dumbledore (who had long believed that Voldemort was certain to return at some point) and instead devoted his time and effort to slandering the two viciously, as he believed it was some insidious plot to usurp him. A Dementor attack on Harry and his cousin in the Muggle suburb of Little Whinging nearly got Harry expelled from Hogwarts when he violated the Decree for the Reasonable Restriction of Underage Sorcery by casting a Patronus Charm in self-defence, but he was found not guilty by the court thanks to Dumbledore. Fudge also used his influence to force Hogwarts to accept a Ministry-appointed teacher, his Senior Undersecretary Dolores Umbridge, in order to gain control of the school and limit Dumbledore's power there. Hagrid's half-giant status also meant that Umbridge was highly prejudiced against him, viewing him as a "filthy half-breed", and so she became quite determined to get rid of him. Umbridge's biased and insulting inspections of his classes made Hagrid rather nervous, and he was soon placed on probation. Though Dumbledore was able to prevent him from being sacked outright, he was forced to flee the school when an illegal student organisation, Dumbledore's Army, was discovered and treated as proof of his supposed treason and Umbridge was named Headmistress in his place. Hagrid's case was not helped by the open rebellion of the school against Umbridge which had one student, Lee Jordan, causing havoc for her by placing Nifflers in her office to wreck the place, one of which also tried to bite a chunk out of her as well. On the night of Wednesday 17th June, 1996, Umbridge and a delegation of five Aurors, including John Dawlish, set out of the castle to arrest Hagrid.

educational decree number twentythree.summary: The Educational Decree Number Twenty-Three was passed and formally approved by Minister Cornelius Fudge, on the evening of 8 September 1995, supposedly to ensure Hogwarts had satisfactory teaching staff and apparatus, and to weed out any less-than-competent professors. The real reason, however, was just an excuse to give Dolores Umbridge more power over the other teachers, and to eliminate any potential threat against the Ministry of Magic. Others were revolted by the creation of said post: Griselda Marchbanks and Tiberius Ogden, both active members of the Wizengamot, left their posts at the Ministry in protest and were subsequently discredited by the Daily Prophet (which connected them to subversive Goblin groups). Because of the post's intrusive purpose, many teachers find it offensive as well, as Professors Minerva McGonagall and Severus Snape tried their best to ignore Umbridge's interrupting methods, answering her in a haughty and cold manner. Sybill Trelawney, who had a harder time in keeping her emotion, was very offended by Umbridge's inspection, and believed it was an insult from the establishment. The decree was abolished and excluded from law after Dolores Umbridge's suspension from her post of High Inquisitor and Albus Dumbledore's formal reinstatement to the post of Headmaster, following the Battle of the Department of Mysteries, in the summer of 1996.

hogwarts high inquisitor.summary: She was appointed, after the Ministry of Magic believed that headmaster Albus Dumbledore was slipping in keeping order and preventing "lies" being spread about Lord Voldemort returning. In truth, the position only came to be due to Minister Fudge being paranoid of Dumbledore attempting to take over the Ministry, and assigned Umbridge to keep an eye on the situation. Supposedly certain people, such as parents of students, were supportive of this post, as they feared that Dumbledore's eccentric decisions may have had a negative impact on the students and were glad that the Ministry was keeping an eye on the situation; however, Lucius Malfoy, who gave an interview of his support of the post's creation under the false pretence of caring for the school's future, was in truth desiring for this action to discredit Dumbledore. Other people, such as Griselda Marchbanks and Tiberius Ogden, were outraged by this post's formation, as they supported Dumbledore and knew full well that the High Inquisitor was nothing more than an excuse for Fudge to usurp control over Hogwarts from the headmaster. As High Inquisitor, Umbridge lurked in the corners of many classes taking notes on her clipboard and asking teachers and students questions. She was disliked by most of the teachers at Hogwarts, especially Minerva McGonagall, who was especially curt and rude to her at times. Despite McGonagall and Snape's apathetic and cold treatment of her, Umbridge could not deny that they were good teachers and knew their subjects, and thus they were not sacked. After a series of poor performances in Umbridge's inspections, were she was unable to answer a series of questions, she was put on probation and then fired from the post of Divination teacher.

order of dismissal.summary: In 1996, then-High Inquisitor of Hogwarts Dolores Umbridge (presumably in lieu of the headmaster) and then-Minister for Magic Cornelius Fudge signed Sybill Trelawney's Order of Dismissal, due to her inadequate performance. Later that year, when Umbridge was dismissed from Hogwarts herself, Sybill's dismissal order was annulled, and she was reinstated as the school's Divination teacher by Dumbledore.

firestorm.summary: The caster might also shoot jets or balls of flame at individual targets or opponents while the fire was still being produced, which would inflict a small amount of damage to them. In June of 1997, Professor Albus Dumbledore and his student Harry Potter entered a seaside cave in an attempt to locate one of Lord Voldemort's Horcruxes. When the Inferi guarding the horcrux attacked them, Dumbledore used this spell, (with the Elder Wand) to drive them back into the water and protect Harry and himself until they reached their boat, therefore saving Harry's life.

gnarlak.summary: He ran The Blind Pig, a magical speakeasy located at 124 Macdougal Street in New York in the 1920s, which Newt Scamander visited when he was searching for information. During her time as an Auror, Porpentina Goldstein used Gnarlak as an informant and was familiar with his establishment, The Blind Pig, and the business which occurred therein. While looking for Newton Scamander's missing animals, Tina suggested that Gnarlak could be useful in their hunt. Tina, Newt, Jacob Kowalski and Queenie Goldstein met with Gnarlak, whereupon they attempted to bargain for information. Gnarlak indicated that he wasn't interested in gold or trinkets, but when Newt offered an ashwinder egg, his interest was piqued. However, Gnarlak then spotted Pickett, one of Newt's Bowtruckles, and was greatly interested, as they were reportedly able to pick locks. However, Gnarlak had already informed MACUSA of Newt's location in an attempt to reap the bounty on his head. As Gnarlak laughed with perceived victory, Jacob punched him in the face, noting that Gnarlak reminded him of his foreman. As Gnarlak lay unconscious on the floor, Newt retrieved Pickett and apparated away with Jacob, Tina and Queenie, leaving Gnarlak to face the Aurors upon regaining consciousness.

wandless magic.summary: Usually, witches and wizards accustomed to using wands could only reliably perform wandless magic if they possessed great skill. However, within regions of the wizarding world that historically did not use wands, wandless magic was considered the norm, and using one was optional. Wands were used by witches and wizards to channel their magic, making their spells more accurate and potent. Within cultures where wands were ubiquitous, only the most powerful and disciplined wizards and witches could perform wandless magic reliably. Wandless magic was not officially taught at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry; however, books on the subject were found in the Restricted Section of the Hogwarts Library. Wandless magic could also be performed nonverbally, but this increased the level of difficulty to the point that only practitioners of exceptional skill could perform more than the most basic magic. Gellert Grindelwald, an infamous Dark Wizard active in the Global wizarding war, was also extremely skilled with wandless magic, having performed it numerous times without difficulty during the conflict. Wandless spells were often used in cases of underage magic, in which children under the age of eleven, who had no wands, sometimes used magic.

ron perlman.summary: Ronald N. "Ron" Perlman (born 13 April, 1950) is an American actor who portrays Gnarlak in Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them. He has a long history of characters in heavy make-up, dating back to Vincent the 'lion-man' in the 1980s TV series of Beauty and the Beast, and more recently was one of the leads on the first five seasons of Sons of Anarchy.

goblin magic.summary: This magic had the potential of being channelled through a wand, as Hodrod the Horny-Handed infamously demonstrated during the Chipping Clodbury riot in 1999, but goblin possession of wands had been outlawed by the Ministry of Magic since the inception of the Wand Ban (Clause Three of the Code of Wand Use), passed in 1631. Goblins resented this fact bitterly as, in Griphook's words, this was the wizards' way of denying them the chance of extending their powers through the study of wandlore.

pickett.summary: In 1926, Pickett accompanied Newt on his journey to New York, sitting inside his top pocket. Pickett was still hidden in Newt's pocket when Gellert Grindelwald, in the guise of Percival Graves, wrongfully sentenced them to death. As bowtruckles are able to pick locks, Pickett was able to release Newt from his shackles and help Newt and Tina escape from the Death Cell. Later, when Newt met the goblin gangster Gnarlak, Newt agreed to give Pickett to him as part of a deal to obtain information about the last missing beasts. In the resulting fray, Jacob punched Gnarlak out so Newt was able to rescue Pickett and escape. When Newt and Jacob Kowalski found Tina imprisoned by Yusuf Kama in his hideout in the Paris' sewers, they were also imprisoned by him. Pickett then snuck out of Newt's pocket and caused Leta to find Newt and Tina at the French Ministry of Magic Records Room.

the blind pig.summary: The Blind Pig was a wizarding speakeasy and jazz club that operated during the 1920s in New York. Accessed via an enchanted poster in a seedy New York back alley, The Blind Pig is an underground bar and hangout for down-and-outs of the American wizarding world. Here amongst the smoke and grime, patrons will likely see dodgy dealings, goblin jazz singers and house-elves serving gigglewater. The band features a lot of different instruments that needed to be played but only four goblins to play them all so, out of practical necessity, the overworked goblin that acted as the brass section became a multi-instrumentalist. Newt Scamander visited The Blind Pig while looking for information about the trouble befalling New York in 1926 and spoke with the owner Gnarlak in person.

hypnosis.summary: The Circus Arcanus, a magical freak show that travelled internationally in the 1920s, included Borys the Brute, a "perfidious" hypnotist of whose "artful deception" the public were warned to be wary. During the 1990–1991 school year at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, both Dolores Umbridge and Ismelda Murk were hypnotised and attacked by a rogue Wampus cat in Hogsmeade, which made them forget what happened to them. Jacob's sibling, working with the Beast Division of the Ministry of Magic, investigated the attacks and managed to stun the cat, which was later placed in the care of Rubeus Hagrid and Professor Kettleburn.

manager of gambol and japes wizarding jo.summary: The individual was a British wizard who worked as the manager of Gambol and Japes Wizarding Joke Shop, in Diagon Alley London. He was working as the manager of Gambol and Japes Wizarding Joke Shop in Diagon Alley sometime before August 1992. When Harry Potter entered his shop that year whilst shopping in Diagon Alley, he brought some packets of Stink Pellets from him for four galleons each, along with some additional Non-explodable, luminous balloons.

verity.summary: 1996) was a British witch and shop assistant that worked for Fred and George Weasley in Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes. She seemed to follow a chain of command; in the 1996 summer holidays, Harry Potter overheard her use the formal title "Mister" to address Fred and George. When Fred and George went into hiding and closed the shop in Diagon Alley, it is also possible she went into hiding if she was not already in hiding.

broom shop shopkeeper.summary: He was a polite man, as he would let first year students browse around his shop, even though he refused to sell them anything, as broomsticks are contraband for first years at Hogwarts.

the junk shop.summary: The Junk Shop was a shop located in South Side of Diagon Alley, next to Second-Hand Robes which sold junks and secondhand items such as broken wands, lopsided scales, etc.

clutterbuck crispe.summary: Clutterbuck is an anglicised form of a Dutch surname, which arrived in England either with Flemish weavers King Edward III had come to England to teach their techniques to the English in the 14th century, or with Huguenots who fled the Netherlands in the 16th century to escape religious persecution.

comet 260.summary: After winning her first house match, Skye Parkin received a new Comet 260 from her father. She intended to give her previous Comet 220 to her protegee, Jacob's Sibling, as her friend had no broom of their own, but the broom went missing. Hagrid felt responsible and, with the support of the house team, he and Madam Hooch arranged for Jacob's sibling to also receive a 260. Ron Weasley believed the Comet 260 looked flashy, but they were not in the same league as the Nimbus 2000. Two years later, Oliver Wood claimed a Comet 260 would look like "a joke" next to a Firebolt, and after seeing the two brooms in action, Lee Jordan agreed that Cho Chang's Comet was "no match" for Harry Potter's Firebolt. The Auror and Order of the Phoenix member Nymphadora Tonks owned one of these brooms, and flew with hers to help transport Harry Potter from 4 Privet Drive to 12 Grimmauld Place as part of the Advance Guard. There was a tantrum during the Gryffindor Quidditch team's tryouts in 1996 that involved a crashed Comet 260 and several broken teeth.

galloloans.summary: GalloLoans was a wizarding financial services company based at 343, South Side, Diagon Alley, London. GalloLoans seems to be a parody of businesses that provide High-cost Short-term credit loans, commonly called payday loans. Such businesses are infamous for their high cost for payback and aggressive collection practices, with some considering them predatory, especially when targeted at low-income individuals needing extra money to cover monthly expenses. Though a 239.45% interest rate seems excessive, costs for such loans can quickly spiral out of control if not repaid promptly. "Robbing sorcerer to pay sorceress" is a pun on "Robbing Peter to pay Paul", an idiom describing borrowing money and incurring a debt to pay off another debt.

archibald bennett.summary: The name "Archibald" was derived from the Germanic elements ercan "genuine" and bald "bold". The first element was altered due to the influence of Greek names beginning with the element αρχος (archos) meaning "master".

manager of flourish and blotts.summary: When the The Monster Book of Monsters became one books required by students at Hogwarts, he had to cope with the new additions to his book list attacking both each other and him; the manager spent much of that summer vowing never to stock that book again. Whenever he had to grab a copy for a customer, he would become rather unhappy due to the books' viciousness; while he was relieved that Harry already got a copy beforehand, he was on the verge of tears when Ronald Weasley and Hermione Granger requested two copies total. He also recommend Harry to not buy Death Omens: What to Do When You Know the Worst is Coming, as it was enough to frighten anyone to death, and in general doesn't recommend reading books about death omens because one would start seeing them everywhere.

twilfitt and tattings.summary: After a confrontation between Draco Malfoy and Harry Potter, Ron Weasley and Hermione Granger in Madam Malkin's Robes for All Occasions in 1996, Narcissa Malfoy and her son left the shop. Among their range of clothes, one could purchase the following items: suede Top Hat with Ribbon (black, blue, brown), pointed Wizards' Hat (black, green, blue), and pointed Wizards' Hat with Buckle (blue, red, green). It is likely that Twilfitt and Tattings was considered more upper class than Madam Malkin's Robes for All Occasions, because wealthy pure-blood families like the Malfoys favoured it.

bilton bilmes.summary: Bilton Bilmes was born somewhere in the British Isles into a wizarding family of unknown blood status, and attended Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. Sometime either during his schooling or after he graduated from Hogwarts, he poured Bulbadox powder in Horace Slughorn's mead as a prank. He once accidentally set off some Stink Pellets in the closet in his home and, unable to get the smell out, resolved to burn every piece of clothing he owned and buy new ones, only to accidentally burn his home to the ground in the process. Loud and affable, and with a childlike fondness and enthusiasm for pranks and mischief, Bilton was always happy to accommodate the young scoundrels of Hogwarts Castle with the latest within classical trouble-making whenever they came to his shop looking for prank devices, and actively encouraged their practical jokes.

madam puddifoots tea shop.summary: A bell over the door announced customers in a tuneful tinkle; the round tables were decorated with lacy napkins and china sugar bowls, and cramped up the small shop to the point that Madam Puddifoot has great difficulty in moving in between tables to serve the couples. While Cho Chang thought the place was nice and cute, Harry Potter was not fond of the appearance nor atmosphere, as it reminded him uncomfortably of Dolores Umbridge's office, and the sight of couples being so intimate with each other made him feel even more uncomfortable. On Valentine's Day, the tearoom was decorated with golden cherubs hovering over each of the tables, which occasionally threw pink confetti over the people sitting below them. Sometime between 1956 and the 1980s, this was where Elphinstone Urquart first proposed to Minerva McGonagall while he was on holiday in Scotland. During the 1987–1988 school year, Jacob's sibling, Charles Weasley and Nymphadora Tonks found this location and decided it was a good place for a date for the former. Sometime in 1995, Cedric Diggory and Cho Chang came to Madam Puddifoot's on a date. On Valentine's Day in 1996, Harry Potter and Cho Chang had a cup of coffee here, and sat by Roger Davies and his girlfriend.

diagon alley stalls.summary: In 1996, an office called the Office for the Detection and Confiscation of Counterfeit Defensive Spells and Protective Objects had to be created to deal with such offences. Some time later, a peddler attempted to sell Molly Weasley one of these amulets, which his signage claimed were effective against werewolves, Dementors and Inferi, but he was not successful because her husband, who was the current Head of the Office for the Detection and Confiscation of Counterfeit Defensive Spells and Protective Objects, was together and threatened to arrest the dealer if he was on duty.

gambol and japes wizarding joke shop.summary: Gambol and Japes Wizarding Joke Shop was a shop located in South Side, Diagon Alley that sold a wide range of joke items and other products that served as entertainment. It was presumably the favourite shop of Fred and George Weasley, and Lee Jordan. It was there that they stocked up on Dr Filibuster's Fabulous Wet-Start, No-Heat Fireworks in 1992.

hermes.summary: Hermes was purchased for Percy by his father as a reward for becoming a Gryffindor prefect in his fifth year at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. In 1993, Hermes was stacked along with Hedwig and other belongings at the Leaky Cauldron before the departure to King's Cross Station. In 1995, Percy used Hermes to deliver a letter to his brother Ronald, advising him not to trust Harry Potter any longer and side with Dolores Umbridge and the British Ministry of Magic.

screech owl.summary: On 24 June, 1995, one of these owls delivered Hermione Granger her morning's copy of the Daily Prophet. This was "as usual," so it is possible that this paper was always delivered to her by one of these birds, though on 2 September of that year at the start of the new school year, the paper was delivered to her by a barn owl instead. Just a bit later in the year, however, she had another copy delivered to her by a screech owl. During the summer holidays of that year, another of these owls sent Harry Potter an official letter from Mafalda Hopkirk telling him that he had been expelled from Hogwarts and that Ministry representatives were coming to destroy his wand.

repelling spell.summary: It was often used during "Cuaditch" (13th century-Quidditch) matches by members of the crowd to stop Golden Snidgets from escaping past the borders of the Quidditch pitch.

endofterm feast.summary: This Feast was notable for including the awarding of the House Cup to the house with the highest points. Although most of these feasts are very happy and exciting times, at the end of the 1994–1995 school year, the End-of-Term feast was subdued because of the death of Hufflepuff student Cedric Diggory.

house cup.summary: The House Cup was a yearly award given at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. Points were given to Houses by teachers and prefects throughout the year for various things including answering questions correctly and doing good deeds. The hourglasses were filled with different jewels for each house - Gryffindor's were rubies, Ravenclaw's sapphires, Slytherin's emeralds and Hufflepuff's diamonds. The House cup championship was also a part of Ilvermorny School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, introduced a few years after the school's founding once there were enough students.

hogwarts potions champion.summary: During their years at the school, the individual found the Book of Potions in the library, classified as dangerous by the librarian. In the book, the individual found the lingering spirit of 16th century potioneer Zygmunt Budge. Zygmunt Budge, still angry centuries later at being unable to enter the Wizarding Schools Potions Championship (because he was 14 at the time, three years younger than the minimum age), revealed that he wished to guide the wizard to winning the championship using the Book of Potions. Using a Portkey disguised as a boot, the individual, aged 17 or above, entered the Wizarding Schools Potions Championship against a Koldovstoretz student, a Mahoutokoro student, and an Uagadou student. The Mahoutokoro potions champion first went across the bridge, awakening a River Troll. In order to pass, the Hogwarts potions champion produced a Shrinking Solution and used it to incapacitate the troll. Soon after, the Koldovstoretz potions champion arrived at the battlefield but was knocked out by a Red Cap he had disturbed while crossing it. In order to keep up and have any chance at winning, the Hogwarts potions champion had to safely get through the field.

gold cauldron.summary: On his first visit to Diagon Alley, Harry Potter wanted to purchase a gold cauldron, but Rubeus Hagrid disallowed it, since his supply list specified pewter.

niko nenad.summary: Niko Nenad (d. 1809) was a Romanian wizard who played as a Beater for the Romanian National Quidditch team in the early 19th century. During the quarter- and semi-finals of the 1809 Quidditch World Cup, the other players on the Romanian team witnessed him knock himself over the head with his own broom, and set his feet on fire out of frustration. His teammates became so concerned with his behaviour that they tried to convince the team's manager to replace him with another player for the final — which was to be played between Romania and New Spain on the West Siberian Plain — but he chose not to listen. Prior to the final, Nenad jinxed the whole of the forest adjacent to the pitch, handsomely paying local Siberian Dark Wizards to help him carry out the job, and possibly also calling upon less-principled fans. Two hours into the game, when New Spain were ahead on points and Romania were exhausted, Nenad deliberately sent a Bludger flying into the forest.

tree animating jinx.summary: In point of fact, this jinx was used by Niko Nenad and several Dark Wizards to animate an entire forest at the final of the 1809 Quidditch World Cup in Siberia.

great sasquatch rebellion of 1892.summary: Due to the risk magical creatures posed of exposing the wizarding world, the MACUSA was less tolerant toward magical creatures than the European wizarding governments, which may have consequently angered the sasquatches, with the MACUSA trying to exert control over them. The onslaught of the Sasquatches ultimately forced the MACUSA to move its headquarters from Washington to New York: this was the fifth time since its inception that the seat of the wizarding government was relocated.

wizard broadway.summary: As reported by W. Lozzus in the 6 December 1926 evening edition of The New York Ghost, Ortiz O'Flaherty's highly-acclaimed book, Big Foot's Last Stand, was to be the subject of a Wizard Broadway adaptation.

big foots last stand.summary: As reported by W. Lozzus in the 6 December 1926 sunset edition of The New York Ghost, this book was to be adapted into a play for Wizard Broadway.

washington.summary: In 1892, Sasquatches staged a large-scale rebellion against the Magical Congress of the United States of America, forcing them to move to New York City.

dress robes.summary: Dress robes are a formal variety of robes worn by witches and wizards for special occasions, and can vary in style and colour as much as everyday robes. For the purposes of this page, "dress robes" also includes wizarding garments not necessarily robe-like in fashion, but worn at the same or similar events. Harry Potter's dress robes for the Ball - and the first set he ever owned - were cut in the same style as his school robes, but coloured green instead of black. The students and teachers of Hogwarts wore dress robes at the Funeral of Albus Dumbledore and attendees of the Wedding of Bill Weasley and Fleur Delacour donned them as well, as they would have for any comparable party or special event.

snyde family.summary: The Snydes tried for years to find and steal the Sword of Gryffindor, but failed each time. Years ago, some Snyde read that they would find the sword if they went "back to the source". However, on the eve of Hallowe'en in 1986, Merula Snyde suggested that the sword might have been buried with Godric Gryffindor. According to Merula Snyde, the Snydes were able to afford their daughter an expensive broom, owned a unicorn at one point, and had/has jewelled shells which resided in the Snyde family vault within Gringotts, suggesting that the Snyde family was quite wealthy.

merula snydes wand.summary: Like most wizards and witches in Great Britain, Merula Snyde most likely purchased her wand at Ollivanders in Diagon Alley, before starting the first year of her magical education at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry in 1984. At Hogwarts, Merula quickly proved herself to be a highly skilful and gifted young witch, and was capable of casting rather powerful spells with her wand. She was also surprisingly skilled in the Dark Arts, being able to cast various dark charms such as the Knockback Jinx proficiently and even being able to summon Fiendfyre. Furthermore, she was even capable of conjuring a non-corporeal Patronus during her Hogwarts years, a mark of superior magical ability and a spectacular feat for a witch of her age then, considering the immense difficulty of casting the said spell.

muriels tiara.summary: Muriel consented to lend the tiara to Fleur Delacour for her wedding to Molly's son, Bill, in 1997. After the wedding, so much went on that Fleur was unable to return the tiara until the following Easter, when Garrick Ollivander brought it with him after being moved from Shell Cottage. Muriel was said to be pleased to get the tiara back, as they had kept it for so long, she had thought they had stolen it. When he saw the tiara, Griphook made it obvious in an implicit way that he considered it to be goblin property.

harry potters dress robes.summary: Harry Potter wore dress robes which looked similar to the Hogwarts uniform, but were bottle green in colour, to the Yule Ball for the 1994 Triwizard Tournament. He also wore dress robes to several other occasions as well. She thought that they would look better on him, because the green colour matched Harry's eyes. Ron Weasley said they were "all right", as they were not as hideous looking as his own dress robes. In December 1996, Harry wore dress robes to Slughorn's Christmas party, which he attended with Luna Lovegood, as his party guest. He also wore dress robes to Bill and Fleur's wedding in August 1998. The dress robes he wore to the wedding were purple and black. The dress robes he wore to the wedding appeared to look more like a suit then anything else.

hogwarts uniform.summary: The uniform must be worn every day in every lesson, and kept on while in the Great Hall, Study Hall, Common Room or Library. Students may wear casual clothing when they have the day, or the rest of the day, free. The uniform was washed in the laundry, which was located somewhere in Hogwarts Castle and presumably operated by the house-elves enlisted by the school. The required uniform consisted of a plain work robes, which during the early 1900s was blue, and in the later years was black, and a black pointed hat for the day. Any pupil who held a position for which a badge ws given, such as those for Prefects, displayed them on their uniform. The constituents of the Hogwarts uniform could be purchased in Diagon Alley, at Madam Malkin's Robes for All Occasions and other needed clothing articles, but alternative options existed, such as Twilfitt and Tattings or the Second-Hand Robes shop. In the late 1900s and early 1910s, as well as the 1920s, the uniform is navy blue, with the girls wearing tartan skirts. In the late 1930s and early 1940s, the film replaced a robe with a grey blazer with the emblem of the house the pupil is in.

gryffindor tower reading room.summary: A crawlspace in one of the walls (covered by the portrait of Valeria Myriadd in the 1991-1992 school year and the portrait of Oraclitus Spheer in the 1992-1993 school year) linked this room to sixth floor or seventh floor disused bathrooms, which was used by Fred and George Weasley as a shop.

florean fortescues ice cream parlour.summary: On Harry Potter's first visit to Diagon Alley, Rubeus Hagrid presented him with a large ice cream (chocolate and raspberry flavoured with chopped nuts), which likely came from Fortescue's establishment. Harry bought strawberry-and-peanut-butter ice cream for himself, Ron Weasley, and Hermione Granger while they strolled around Diagon Alley during their visit in 1992. When Harry spent three weeks staying at the Leaky Cauldron and hanging around Diagon Alley in August of 1993, he spent a lot of time at the Parlour doing his homework. In 1996, Bill Weasley mentioned that Mr Fortescue had been "dragged off" by the looks of the ice cream parlour.

weasley supplies bargain basement.summary: The Weasley Supplies Bargain Basement (or simply Weasley Twins Bargain) was, in conjunction with Weasley Candy Emporium, a small business created by the Weasley twins during the 1991-1992 school year. It was a small shop, ran by George Weasley, in which miscellaneous items and clothes, such as cauldrons and wizard's hats, could be purchased and/or sold.

23 april.summary: 23 April is the 113th day of the year (114th in leap years).

24 april.summary: 24 April is the 114th day of the year (115th in leap years).

maisie cattermole.summary: Mary Cattermole said that Maisie and her siblings were frightened by their mother's interrogation by the Muggle-Born Registration Commission. They were probably not attending Hogwarts yet, because Harry Potter told her and her husband to pick up the children and run away.

great tolling.summary: The Cattermoles lived in this town prior to the events surrounding Mary Cattermole's interrogation before the Muggle-Born Registration Commission.

alfred cattermole.summary: Her mother told the Ministry that Alfred and his sisters were at home. They were probably not attending Hogwarts yet, because Ron Weasley told her and her husband to pick up the children and run away. "Alfred" is derived from the Old English name Ælfræd, composed of the elements ælf "elf" and ræd "counsel". His fame helped to ensure the usage of this name even after the Norman conquest, when most Old English names were replaced by Norman ones.

syna hyslop.summary: After they died, their relatives found that their home contained duplicates of every item inside, down to the set of hand-written instructions for the Doubling Charm that each twin left on one of the matching tables in the kitchen.

wandextinguishing charm.summary: The Wand-Extinguishing Charm (Nox) was a charm that caused the light at the end of the caster's wand to be extinguished, thus acting as the counter-charm to the Wand-Lighting Charm (Lumos). The Wand-Extinguishing Charm was invented by the same witch who invented the Wand-Lighting Charm, Levina Monkstanley. She invented the Wand-Lighting charm in the 18th century and invented the Wand-Extinguishing Charm around that time too, otherwise her wand would remain lighted indefinitely. This spell was taught to first year students in Charms class at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry in the 1984–1985 school year by Professor Filius Flitwick.

scarpins revelaspell.summary: Professor Horace Slughorn instructed his sixth year potions class to use this spell in a lesson on antidotes, although most of them were absolutely clueless.

blackboard writing spell.summary: The Blackboard Writing Spell was taught in sixth year Charms classes in the 1989–1990 school year at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. At the start of the 1995–1996 school year at Hogwarts, Severus Snape and Dolores Umbridge both used this charm in their first lessons with fifth year students to write instructions on their blackboards.

antiunlocking charms.summary: However, doors protected with these spells were still potentially vulnerable to physical force, as Jacob Kowalski was able to kick in the door to Percival Graves's office after Queenie Goldstein was unable to open it magically. In 1926, Queenie Goldstein speculated that there were sophisticated anti-unlocking charms protecting the door to Percival Graves's office after she was unable to use Alohomora and Aberto to open it.

spell creation.summary: Only witches and wizards with great understanding of and skill on magic were known to be able to invent spells. It is unknown what the exact process was to creating spells other than crafting the wand movement and the incantation. If something went wrong, the results could prove fatal; an example of this is Pandora Lovegood's experimentation.

sydney.summary: After having their memories modified by their daughter in the summer of 1997, Mr and Mrs Granger moved to this city, opening a small sweet shop. On 14 December 2018, a Muggle speed camera captured blurry footage of several out-of-control riderless Nimbus 2000 broomsticks speeding on a motorway in Sydney.

25 april.summary: 25 April is the 115th day of the year (116th in leap years).

argentina.summary: Not much is known about the Argentinian wizarding community, although the 2014 Quidditch World Cup was based in the Patagonian Desert, receiving a large amount of people from the international wizarding community. The Argentinian Council of Magic was the main governing body of the magical community of Argentina.

wales.summary:
Wales is a country located on the island of Great Britain, which is bordered by England. In 1993, the Knight Bus picked up Madam Marsh from Abergavenny in Wales. During the same journey, the Knight Bus passed through Anglesey which is also in Wales. Sometime in or prior to 1994, a mystery regarding the Dark Arts took place in Wales. Helga Hufflepuff, one of the four founders of Hogwarts, possibly came from Wales. Wales has its own National Quidditch team, which in 1994 lost to Uganda during the 422nd Quidditch World Cup. The following creatures are found throughout Great Britain:The following creatures are found in certain regions of Europe that Wales falls under:
The following creatures are found throughout the Atlantic Ocean:
The following creatures were all found worldwide:

oceania.summary: The New Zealander capital city of Wellington, and island of Moutohora along with the Australian cities of Thundelarra and Wollongong were known locations that house the Oceanian wizarding community.

cardiff.summary: In August 1877, the Argentinian National Quidditch team were found bound in the basement of a pub in Cardiff following that year's scheduled Quidditch World Cup, which nobody in the wizarding world could actually remember happening for an unknown reason.

peruvian national quidditch team.summary: The Peruvian team was "flattened" in the semi-finals by Ireland.

two to tango.summary: It was advertised as returning to Broadway at The Kingly Court in New York for four weeks beginning on the evening of Monday 29 November 1926. This production featured a "star-studded" cast, including leading actor Angelo Benitez, who was accompanied by a troupe of thirty Argentine dancers. It was directed by Wallace Rosenberg, choreographed by Edwin Halsted, and featured costumes by Vincent Davies.

the kingly court.summary: A four-week run of the musical Two to Tango, directed by Wallace Rosenberg and starring Angelo Benitez, was staged at The Kingly Court starting on the evening of Monday 29 November 1926.

urg the unclean.summary: For his role in the Goblin Rebellions, he was featured on one Chocolate Frog Card. When Ron Weasley sat his fourth year History of Magic final, he forgot some of the names of the goblin rebels, and thus invented a few as cover, stating that this was easy because "they're all called stuff like Bodrod the Bearded and Urg the Unclean."

dreadful.summary: Dreadful was one of the three failing grades, out of six grades overall, in the Ordinary Wizarding Levels, Nastily Exhausting Wizarding Tests, and Wizards' Ordinary Magic and Basic Aptitude Tests. It was the second lowest mark, immediately below 'Poor' and immediately above 'Troll'. This was the same for the other failing grades: 'Poor' and 'Troll'. It is unknown if a student could repeat the subject if they received a 'Dreadful'.

poor.summary: Poor was the highest of the three failing grades, out of six grades overall, in the Ordinary Wizarding Levels, Nastily Exhausting Wizarding Tests, and Wizards' Ordinary Magic and Basic Aptitude Tests. It was the third lowest mark, immediately below 'Acceptable' and immediately above 'Dreadful'. for a particular subject, the student had failed that subject and was unable to continue on with it as a N.E.W.T. The student however, did have the option to repeat the subject, if they chose to do so.

troll grade.summary: Troll was one of the three failing grades, out of six grades overall, in the Ordinary Wizarding Levels, Nastily Exhausting Wizarding Tests, and Wizards' Ordinary Magic and Basic Aptitude Tests. It was the lowest mark, immediately below 'Dreadful'. It appeared to generally be reserved for those who received the worst score possible, usually through making an extra effort to fail. Some people, including Hermione Granger, did not know it existed, hinting that the grade was seldom attributed. exam, they had failed that subject and were thus unable to continue with that class at N.E.W.T.-level.

candle.summary: Some magical candles can be lit by walking past them, or by waving a hand in front of them. Albus Dumbledore, Remus Lupin, and Rita Skeeter are three wizards known to have lit candles magically. The Hut-on-the-Rock had candles on the mantelpiece of the fireplace, the only source of light in the dark and dingy old hut. On 31 October 1992, Nearly Headless Nick's Deathday party was lit by Jet black candles with thin blue flames. In 1993, strings of enchanted candles were hung in the trees of Hogsmeade at Christmastime. In 1994 whilst interviewing Harry Potter before the Wand weighing ceremony, Rita Skeeter took some candles from her handbag, and non-verbally lit and levitated them into the air in a Hogwarts broom cupboard. Bathilda Bagshot had a number of candles in her home, which she lit with matches when Harry Potter and Hermione Granger paid a visit because she seemed to have forgotten that she could do magic.

draconifors spell.summary: The Draconifors Spell (Draconifors) was a transfiguration spell used to transform objects into small dragons. This spell was taught in third-year Transfiguration class by Professor Minerva McGonagall, during the 1993–1994 school year at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. However, it was only a very small transfigured dragon, around the size of an infant, significantly limiting its potential for violence and breathing fire.

troll language.summary: In 1994, while inside the tent during the Quidditch World Cup, Fred Weasley joked about this language when Percy Weasley dreamingly told about Bartemius Crouch Snr's many talents, including this language.

elizabeth i.summary: She was the daughter of King Henry VIII by his second wife, Anne Boleyn, and the half-sister of Mary I. However, there was "ample" evidence suggesting that the first Lucius Malfoy sought her hand in marriage, but was rebuffed by her. During her rule, she was seen as the one the greatest ever rulers of England, with her reign being called the "Golden Age". The name "Elizabeth" comes from Ελισαβετ (Elisabet), the Greek form of the Hebrew name אֱלִישֶׁבַע ('Elisheva') meaning "my God is an oath" or perhaps "my God is abundance".

viaduct.summary: In 1998 during the Battle of Hogwarts, Minerva McGonagall's enchanted suits of armour were stationed on the Viaduct to prevent the Death Eaters to enter the Castle proper. Once the magical protections around Hogwarts were broken, many Death Eaters charged through the Viaduct, as well as the Giants, destroying much of the balustrade.

fireomens.summary: At the start of 1993-1994 school year at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, Professor Sybill Trelawney promised her third year Divination students that they would begin to study crystal-gazing in the summer term, as long as they were done learning about fire-omens by that time. In 1996 at Hogwarts, Firenze taught his fifth year Divination class to burn various herbs and spices such as sage and mallowsweet, and to try and see symbols in the smoke.

unidentified canadian seer.summary: In 1926, they won a jackpot after predicting they would win it, defying the people who doubted the validity of their predictions.

gulliver pokeby.summary: Gulliver Pokeby (1750 - 1839) was a wizard, Magizoologist, expert on magical birds and the author of Why I Didn't Die When the Augurey Cried. He was the first to identify that the Augurey's cries meant rain was coming, rather than impending death.

pierre bonaccord.summary: Bonaccord wanted to ban troll-hunting and grant rights to trolls, possibly granting them full "being" status as opposed to them being classified as "beasts". However, a tribe of Mountain Trolls had been causing a lot of trouble in Liechtenstein, so their wizarding community contested Bonaccord's appointment, and refused to join the Confederation as a result.

allengland wizarding duelling competitio.summary: Alberta Toothill won this championship in 1430 after defeating the favourite, Samson Wiblin, with the Blasting Curse.

spattergroit.summary: Cerebrumous Spattergroit, an especially virulent strain of the fungus, had the additional symptoms of severe confusion and memory loss. A massive outbreak of Cerebrumous Spattergroit was one of several things speculated to have been behind the mystery of why no one in the wizarding world could remember the Quidditch World Cup actually taking place in 1877.
