Oerk, AppFroggy) asking him to not do that (See: "Your attitude",  "A question", "Stop removing our edits"). --RogueOwner (talk) 19:50, June 22, 2020 (UTC)
I'm sorry but is spiteful and ridiculous, and borders on bullying. --RedWizard98 (talk) 20:02, June 22, 2020 (UTC)
This is why I am asking for clarifications on which conversations were being referenced. However, RedWizard you also know better than to edit other people's messages like you just did here, regardless of how benign you think the edit is. Thanks --Ironyak1 (talk) 20:19, June 22, 2020 (UTC)
What messages have I edited since? --RedWizard98 (talk) 20:26, June 22, 2020 (UTC)
I think this whole situation is so bizarre over something which is not an issue.

no personal attacks.summary:
Do not make personal attacks anywhere on the Harry Potter Wiki. Personal attacks will not help you make a point; they hurt the Harry Potter Wiki community, and deter users from helping create and maintain a good encyclopedia. Specific examples of personal attacks include but are not limited to:
Users engaging in debate is an essential part of the culture of the Harry Potter Wiki. Assume good faith, be civil and adhere to good wiki etiquette when stating disagreements to avoid personalising them and try to minimise unnecessarily antagonistic comments. It is important not to personalise comments that are directed at content and actions, but it is equally important not to interpret such comments as personal attacks. Specific examples of comments that are not personal attacks include, but are not limited to:
If you are personally attacked, you should ask the attacker to stop and note this policy.

user rights policy.summary:
The User Rights Policy details the processes by which extra User Rights are granted or requested, maintained through required activity, and possibly removed due to abuse. Administrators can grant additional User Rights in special situations without a community vote if:
The Administrator should clearly specify the reasons for skipping the Harry Potter Wiki:Requests for permissions (RFP) procedure. If at least two Administrators object to the granting of rights then the user will, while retaining their rights, go through the customary RFP process. Users can request additional User Rights at Harry Potter Wiki:Requests for permissions and can post a notification of their nomination on Harry Potter Wiki:Requests for administrator attention to ensure Administration is aware of the request. The user can also request on any Harry Potter Wiki:Administrators' Talk page for them to be the Organising Administrator (OA) of their nomination. In the hopes that a user with extra rights (User) makes use of them regularly, there is a minimal amount of activity required to maintain possession of any extra rights. However, Users are allowed periods of inactivity which fall into two categories:
Minimal Activity: Users with extra rights need to make 119 (7 x 17) total contributions over a 29 week period (7 months & 1 week) excepting prior explanation of inactivity. Additionally, Users must use their extra rights, or perform other actions related to their role, 29 times in the 29 week period, excepting prior explanation of inactivity.

selected pictures.summary:
A small picture of the Hogwarts crest () in the top right corner of an image's description page indicates that the picture is selected. Additionally, each selected picture, along with a short description of what it's about will be shown on the main page for a time period. The rest of this document covers what type of pictures should be considered, the criteria they should be judged by, the nomination/promotion/rejection procedure, and updating of the main page in detail, as well as lists of current selected pictures. Articles nominated for Featured Article status should adhere to the following criteria:
Images should be nominated on Harry Potter Wiki:Selected Pictures nominations. Nomination}} template at the top of the page to produce this:

All failed articles should be tagged with {{Failed S.P. Nomination}} template at the top of the page to produce this:

Voting should be limited to registered users only. After seven days, pictures must be promoted or rejected depending on their vote total.

layout guide.summary:
Generally this guide is to be used for character articles, but can be adapted to almost any in-universe article by leaving out sections that are irrelevant. In addition, if you are unsure of how to start an article use this guide to provide a starting point. Below is a comprehensive, though not necessary complete list of sources for a major Harry Potter character to currently be in:
Succession boxes serve two purposes: to list the time period for which an individual held a certain post/title, and to provide links to their immediate predecessor and/or successor. Due to the tendency of contributors to insert speculation and fanon into succession boxes, it is best to follow these "do nots":
If the individual was the first (last) person to bear a certain title, the "Preceded by" ("Succeeded by") section should read "None". However, if there are some known predecessors/successors, the section should read "Unknown, eventually <name of the chronologically nearest individual>". (Example: Seraphina Picquery's immediate predecessor as President of MACUSA is unknown, therefore, the succession box reads "Unknown, eventually Emily Rappaport".) If the individual in question continues to hold the title "currently" (where the "present" is defined as the date of the last published Harry Potter work), the "Succeeded by" section should read "Incumbent".

committee for the disposal of dangerous.summary: In a Care of Magical Creatures lesson in September of 1993, the Hippogriff Buckbeak injured Draco Malfoy's arm slightly after having been insulted by the boy. The Hogwarts board of governors brought the incident to the Committee's attention, and Buckbeak and Hagrid were summoned to a hearing on 20 April, 1994. They did this in order to help Hagrid make a strong argument in Buckbeak's favour, but their efforts were ultimately in vain. After the hearing, the Committee set a date for Buckbeak's execution, even though legally there was still the possibility of another appeal. On the appointed day, 6 June 1994, Cornelius Fudge went to Hogwarts to act as a witness in Buckbeak's execution, along with an elderly Committee member and Walden Macnair, the executioner. When Macnair attempted to carry out the sentence, however, Buckbeak was nowhere to be found, having already been freed by Harry and Hermione, with the use of a Time-Turner.

levi pinfold.summary: Working as a self employed illustrator, his debut picture book was The Django, inspired his love of music. Levi won The Book Trust Early Years Award in the Best Emerging Illustrator Category in 2010, and was chosen for the Book Trust Best New Illustrators Award in 2011. Levi also enjoys writing stories in his spare time and has published a children's book, Black Dog.

invisibility booster.summary: It was activated by a small silver button on the car's dashboard, and would turn the car, its passengers, and everything else inside invisible. On 1 September, 1992, when Harry Potter and Ron Weasley "borrowed" the car to get to Hogwarts, the Invisibility Booster malfunctioned and several Muggles witnessed the car flying overhead.

ford.summary: Several Model Ts were seen driving on the streets of New York during Newt Scamander's visit to the city in 1926. Despite the illegality of magically modifying Muggle artefacts, he gave the car several magical upgrades, including the ability to fly and an invisibility setting.

harry potter book night.summary:
Harry Potter Book Night, also known as HPBN, is an annual event initiated by Bloomsbury Publishing, first announced on 12 October 2014 with the fist event to be held on 5 February 2015. Other publishers known to have promoted the event included: Adriano Salani Editore (Italy), Ediciones Salamandra now part of PRH Grupo Editorial (Spain and Latin America, notably Colombia and Peru), Éditions Gallimard (France),
Егмонт (Bulgaria), and Gramedia Pustaka Utama (Indonesia). The 1st Harry Potter Book Night had 10,500 parties and celebrations in total
The 2nd annual HPBN had 12,600 parties and celebrations in total. By the 4th annual HPBN, the event had been celebrated in 39 different countries with over 10,000 parties taking place around the world. The 5th annual HPBN had over 476 events over the world, with the most northern event being a school party in Russia, the most southern event at the Khandallah Library, Wellington, New Zealand, and the event furthest away from any other located in an international school in China. The 7th annual HPBN was originally scheduled to be held on 4 February 2021 but was rescheduled; due to Covid-19 restrictions for large-scale gatherings across the world, any activities and ideas were planed by Bloomsbury to be easily adapted to any group size, and suitable for participating virtual online as many as possible.

2 february.summary: There are 332 days remaining (333 in leap years).

benjamin papac.summary: Papac also portrayed Harry Potter, voicing him when the cast of Harry Potter and the Cursed Child read aloud Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone, Chapter 5 (Diagon Alley) together, organised by Bloomsbury Publishing for the 2021 Harry Potter Book Night.

ditions gallimard.summary: On 9 October 1998, Gallimard published Harry Potter à l'école des sorciers. In July 1999, Harry Potter et la Chambre des Secrets was published followed by Harry Potter et le Prisonnier d'Azkaban in October of the same year. Harry Potter et l'Ordre du Phoenix was later published in December 2003, followed by Harry Potter et le Prince de sang-mêlé in October 2005 and finally Harry Potter et les Reliques de la Mort published in October 2007.

privet drive.summary: Privet Drive was a suburban street in Little Whinging, which is located in the county of Surrey, near London in the southeast of England. The Dursleys lived on this street, in Number Four. The type of people who live here seem to be rich, snobbish and extremely nosy; Harry Potter once noted that they were the type who thought "scruffiness ought to be punishable by law". The street has its own postal delivery service, and at least one (Number Four) received the Daily Mail newspaper. On 1 November 1981, Vernon Dursley noticed a tabby cat which standing on the corner of Privet Drive reading a map on a dull, grey Tuesday. That night, the wizard Albus Dumbledore came to Privet Drive and darkened the street with his Deluminator, so the Muggle residents could not see what would be happening. That night, they, along with Rubeus Hagrid (who arrived on the scene with a flying motorbike, came to give a baby Harry Potter over to the Dursleys, after his parents were murdered by Lord Voldemort. In the summer of 1995, Privet Drive was witness to quite a few magical accidents.
